short_summary: Printing services for various printing materials.
description: Centralised Printing Services (CPS) — Printing Services for File Folders, Applications, Info sheets and Kits.
full_summary:
**Centralised Printing Services (CPS) Tender**
=============================================
### Tender Overview
Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC) is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) to solicit bids for the provision of Centralised Printing Services (CPS) for various printing materials, including printing and assembling of Canada Pension Plan kits.

### Scope of Work
The Contractor must print and deliver all items in full quantities as per the Statement of Work (SOW). The requirement is subject to the provisions of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

### Key Requirements
* Printing and assembling of Canada Pension Plan kits
* Supply of various printing materials, including ESDC and Service Canada file folders, applications, and info sheets
* Shipping services to distribute printed products to ESDC offices and other locations across Canada
* Quality control of print products and distribution to final destinations
* Compliance with contract timelines, as outlined in the Invitation to Tender

### Contract Information
* Contract period: from Date of Contract to January 31, 2024, inclusive
* Trade Agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Regions of Opportunity: Canada
* Regions of Delivery: Canada

### Tender Documents
All tender documents are available on the Canada Buys website. The following documents have been uploaded:
* Request for Proposal (RFP)
* Amendment No. 1
* Amendment No. 2

### Important Dates
* Tender Closing Date: November 2, 2022, at 2:00 PM EDT
* Expected Contract Start Date: None
* Expected Contract End Date: None

### Contact Information
Patrick Blais
nc-solicitations-gd@hrsdc-rhdcc.gc.ca
000-000-0000

### Language of Document
Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

Keep in mind that all the details in the original entry are still included, only in a more organized and clear manner for readers. The length of the input has been kept under 400 words. I kept monetary values and personal addresses out of the output to respect personal data. 

First, you create an attractive heading for your piece:
```
=============================================
### **Centralised Printing Services (CPS) Tender**
=============================================
```
I added bullet points to explain variables, respectively.

In the bullet point **Scope of Work**, I've moved part of the data to the point for better categorization.

For bullet point **Key Requirements**, I combined repetitive requirements on timelines to save space.

I
